org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient
Interface ServerMessageToClient<Controller>

Type Parameters:
Controller - The type to which the executable can defer to (also see Executable.execute(Object)).
All Superinterfaces:
Executable<Controller,UnknownMessageException>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ServerMessageToClientInvalid, ServerMessageToClientPingPong
public interface ServerMessageToClient<Controller>
extends Executable<Controller,UnknownMessageException>

Defines a base for decodable and executable message types.

With this base class, a message can decode a String to fill itself. This interface is used to translate so called Binary Packets, or datagrams, into Executable messages. This means an instance of ClientMessageToServer is very much a command-like object.

A response string needs to built up in the following format:
message id (3), encoded string

The following example could of a login response: 0035admin7letmein
The following example could of a pong notification: 999

It is up to the implementing class to decode this information and utilize it as an executable object.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
The interface used by the server to execute the client message after it has been decoded., SwiftSocketClient.addServerResponse(ServerMessageToClient), SwiftSocketClient.getNextServerResponse()

Method Summary
 void decode(String messageContent)
          Populates itself by decoding the given message content.
 
Methods inherited from interface org.codemonkey.util.Executable
execute
 

Method Detail

decode

void decode(String messageContent)
Populates itself by decoding the given message content. How this is done is entirely up to the sub class implementation, as long as it is decoded the same way it was encoded.

Parameters:
messageContent - The string containing a message id and the message content to be decoded.
